primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Triune God calls and constitutes a people (the Church) to participate in His victory over the cosmic power of Evil/Satan, promising restoration after a period of necessary suffering.

subject.identificatie: The God of all Grace / The Risen Lord
tekstueel_bewijs: The God of all grace... will himself restore, establish, and strengthen you.
The people of God have been constituted... by God’s prior choice.
The risen and reigning Messiah is present and active, himself interpreting the scriptures.

object.identificatie: Eternal Glory / Restoration of the Church
tekstueel_bewijs: called you to his eternal glory in Christ
To him be the dominion for ever and ever.
called you to his eternal glory
the Bible is addressed... to the people of God

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Word of God / Christ (as Living Stone)
tekstueel_bewijs: the same Holy Spirit... comes again upon the church
Only through the Word of God is the human being enabled to see what God sees.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Devil / The Malignant Power of Evil / Sin
tekstueel_bewijs: Your adversary the devil prowls around like a roaring lion
the fell and deliberate purpose of the malignant Power of Evil
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but a 'malignant Power' and 'roaring lion' that requires divine intervention to defeat.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Church, empowered by God, resists the devil through worship and outward-facing service.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church (as a corporate body)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The Church acts 'out of' (consequence) rather than 'into' (condition) its foundation in Christ.

voorbeelden_god_subject: The God of all grace... will himself restore.
The presence and power of God take over.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We must pay for our mistake.
Resist him, firm in your faith.
We must learn to resist the lies.

voorbeelden: If we want to raise children as Christians.
knowing that the same experience of suffering is required.
enabled also... to read our present time.
The church resists... because of the call... and presence of God.
The church is able to bear its burden.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes that the 'ability' (Pouvoir) to resist comes from God's prior action and presence, not human willpower.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the reality of S2 (Satan/Suffering) to the necessity of ~S2 (Resistance/Ridicule) through the power of S1 (God's Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved eschatologically: God 'himself' will restore the subject after the suffering.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; uses Rwanda and the Gestapo as referents for S2.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon contains many imperatives (Resist!), they are structurally grounded in God's indicative action. God is the primary actant who restores and establishes.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Focus on human effort in resistance
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We must pay for our mistake by learning to resist.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the active Subject of restoration
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The God of all grace... will himself restore, establish, and strengthen you.
The church resists... not through its own efforts... but because of the call... of God.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as moral templates but as part of a 'God's-eye view' of history.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ is the 'Living Stone' upon which the church is built, not just a hero to imitate.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Security and courage derived from divine promise rather than self-reliance.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic restoration; the believer is the beneficiary of God's cosmic victory.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The secondary program (ethics/resistance) is explicitly derived from the primary program (soteriology/grace).
spanning_punten: The tension between 'God does it all' and the command to 'Resist'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Satan has no chance against the Lord of hosts.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit enables the reading of scripture and the seeing of reality.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; sin is a 'malignant Power' and 'handmaid of Satan'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject while calling for human action.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly heavy on Devoir (commands) in the middle section.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current Pouvoir (God's power) grounding.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'ridicule' of the devil is seen as a participation in Christ's victory.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon avoids the trap of moralism by framing resistance as a liturgical and ontological response to God's prior victory.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the power of the Rwanda/Dallaire anecdotes, Greimas reveals that these stories serve to define the 'Opponent' as cosmic rather than merely social.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek of 1 Peter; semiotics shows how the preacher re-actualizes the 'Subject' role for God in the 21st century.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'resistance' is not a new task for the Subject (Man) but a secondary program of the primary Subject (God).

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully uses the 'Heavy Opponent' to force the hearer to rely on the 'Divine Subject'.
